text.__SUMMARY__: Sedum spurium, the Caucasian stonecrop or two-row stonecrop, is a flowering plant in the family Crassulaceae.
text.Description: Sedum spurium is a herbaceous plant with alternate, simple leaves, on creeping stems. The flowers are pink, borne in spring through fall.
text.Taxonomy: Sedum spurium is one of a number of species of Sedum that segregate amongst the Crassulaceae in the Rhodiola clade, and were placed in the tribe Umbiliceae. These species are generally regarded as forming a separate Genus, Phedimus.}
